Core Statistical Methods for Distributions

Source: R/DistributionDecorator_CoreStatistics.R
CoreStatistics.Rd

Added functionality to distribution objects for numerical statistical methods. Including a generalised expectation function for more complex numerical calculations.

Details

Decorator objects add functionality to the given Distribution object by copying methods in the decorator environment to the chosen Distribution environment. Use the decorate function to decorate a Distribution.

All methods in this decorator use numerical approximations and therefore better results may be available from analytic computations. See below for the methods added to a distribution after decorating with CoreStatistics.

Constructor

CoreStatistics$new(dist)

Constructor Arguments

ArgumentTypeDetails
distdistributionDistribution to decorate.

Added Methods

MethodNameLink
mgf(t)Moment generating functionmgf
pgf(t)Probability generating functionpgf
cf(t)Characteristic functioncf
entropy(base = 2)(Shannon) Entropyentropy
skewness()Skewnessskewness
kurtosis(excess = TRUE)Kurtosiskurtosis
kthmoment(type = "central")Kth Momentkthmoment
genExp(trafo)Generalised ExpectationgenExp
mode(which = "all")Modemode
var()Variancevar
cov()Covariancecov
cor()Correlationcor

See also

DistributionDecorator, decorate and ExoticStatistics

Examples

x = Binomial$new()
decorate(x, CoreStatistics)
#> x is now decorated with CoreStatistics
x$genExp()
#> [1] 5

x = Binomial$new(decorators = CoreStatistics)
x$kthmoment(4)
#> [1] 17.5
